DOC.brief_summary: This study aim assess hypothesis dietary protein content major factor regulate lean body mass gain energy expenditure overfeed , thus long term body weight gain To test hypothesis , healthy normal weight male female subject 7-day hypercaloric , high-sucrose diet ( +40 % excess energy sucrose ) either low ( 5 % total energy ) high ( 20 % total energy ) protein intake . Each subject study hlow- high protein diet accord randomize , crossover study . On occasion follow measurement do basal condition ( 2-day isoenergetic , control diet ) end 7-day overfeeding : - whole-body protein turnover , oxidation synthesis fast condition feed condition ( 13C-labelled leucine ) - intrahepatic intramuscular fat concentration ( 1H-Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy ) - Energy metabolism fast fed condition ( indirect calorimetry ) - plasma concentration glucose , non-esterified fatty acid , total triglyceride , very-low density lipoprotein ( VLDL ) -triglyceride , insulin , glucagon , growth hormone ( GH ) , insulin-like growth factor 1 ( IGF1 ) , insulin-like growth factor bind protein ( IGFBP ) 1,2 3 fast feed condition The effect high-protein low-protein sucrose overfeed whole body protein synthesis compare use two-way ANOVA ; relationship change whole body protein synthesis one hand , intrahepatic/intramuscular fat concentration , total energy expenditure , plasma concentration metabolic variable hand , evaluate linear regression analysis
DOC.brief_title: Effects Milk Proteins Protein Synthesis Healthy Male Subjects Fed Hypercaloric , High Sucrose Diet
DOC.criteria: good apparent health low physical activity nonsmoker vegan follow special diet consumption > 3 dl/day sweeten beverage change body > +/ 3Kg past 3 month contraindication magnetic resonance spectroscopy drug substance abuse consumption > 10g/day alcohol lactose intolerance
